name: Sticks & Stones
description:
If, like me, you spent a large part of your childhood bunking off school so you could play Zak McKracken and the Alien Mindbenders on an Intel 286 PC (look it up, millenials!) then you'll always have had a soft spot in your heart for point and click adventures.

For my August 2016 #OneGameAMonth entry I wanted to attempt my own game in the genre. The good news was that an extremely talented coder named Rafael Garcia has written a point and click adventure engine, the Bladecoder Adventure Engine, complete with an intuitive editor, that runs on my preferred game framework, LibGDX. The bad news was that I couldn't find any decent free artwork to use for the game - so you get hand drawn squiggle-vision instead!

Code by me (and my dog): @RubyIsDog
Music by Kevin MacLeod
Created with Bladecoder Adventure Engine and LibGDX
